subject: Re: [junit] JUnit ANT Target
msgSnippet: Thanks Stefan. Yes I was able to figure that out. It was a ClassNotFound Exception. It is not able to find the target class. I am debugging into it. Can you
messageBody:
Thanks Stefan.

Yes I was able to figure that out. It was a ClassNotFound Exception. It is
not able to find the target class. I am debugging into it.

Can you please let me know how to throw plain formatter ?

-Thanks
Harshal

On 5/10/06, Stefan Bodewig <stefan.bodewig@...> wrote:
>
> On Mon, 8 May 2006, Harshal Shah <shahharshal@...> wrote:
>
> > It does not show any information as well as to what is the cause of
> > the failure.
>
> It says it is an error, not a failure. That means something is
> throwing an exception.
>
>
> > I have set the showoutput to true, printSummary to true and fork to
> > true.
>
> Throw in a plain formatter to get more details.
>
> Stefan
>
>
